title: Index of USB Boot Making Applications

forumNotes.author: maanu
forumNotes.content:
Following is a brief list of different applications which can make your usb device bootable. **1. Fbinst by Bean 2. Fuwi's Usb Boot Utility 3. Make_USB by Wimb 4. BootIce by Pauly 5. RMPrepUSB 6. Disk Genius 7. UBUSB**
I am just giving the little introduction and link to the main topic of that application here on boot-land or to its respective page elsewhere . **1.fbinst ( My Personal Favourite )** **Author: Bean123 (China).** He is also in the devlopment team of Grub4dos, it is basically a command line tool and is very easy to use. You can use as it is from command line or through it's GUI. You can also use my automated fbinst's package which i made for ease of usage so that i wont have to write all those commands again and again myself. **fbinst on bootland forums:** [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=7932](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7932 "External link") [http://www.boot-land...iew=getlastpost](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=11463&view=getlastpost "External link")
**fbinst on znpc forums (Chinese).** [http://bbs.znpc.net/.....;extra=page=1](http://bbs.znpc.net/viewthread.php?tid=5669&extra=page%3D1 "External link")
**latest available download:** fbinst (15.11.09) [http://bbs.znpc.net/...nt.php?aid=3806](http://bbs.znpc.net/attachment.php?aid=3806 "External link") grldr (14.11.09) [http://bbs.znpc.net/...nt.php?aid=3745](http://bbs.znpc.net/attachment.php?aid=3745 "External link")


**fbinst's 1.5 GUI: ( 16.11.09)** [http://bbs.znpc.net/...nt.php?aid=3651](http://bbs.znpc.net/attachment.php?aid=3651 "External link") part 1 [http://bbs.znpc.net/...nt.php?aid=3744](http://bbs.znpc.net/attachment.php?aid=3744 "External link") part 2



WARNING: There were some reports about (false) positives from antivirus software, check the files here: [http://www.virustotal.com/](http://www.virustotal.com/ "External link") if in doubt. **my fbinst's cmdline automated package:** [http://www.boot-land...iew=getlastpost](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=11463&view=getlastpost "External link") which includes latest grldr as of 15.5.2010 . **known Limitations :** it works only on xp , 2k , 2k3 machines ( 32 bit tested) . If you are running any other OS , boot into PE and use it from there. **2. Fuwi's Bootable USB-Drive Utility** **Author: Fuwi (Switzerland).** The package basically uses HP USB format tool, but Fuwi added fixes to remove known glitches in it, to make the usb bootable on as many machines as possible. It also has an option for making a kicker image out of your (Bart) PE folder. It uses grub4dos as main loader. Fuwi's Bootable USB-Drive Utility : [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=21702](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=21702 "External link") Known Limitations : None as of now to my knowledge **3. Make_USB.exe** **Author: Wimb (Netherlands).** It is a small tool from wimb's AIO utilities that takes care of installing xp from usb. It has the option of making a multi partitioned usb device without the need of installing any additional driver by yourself. It also removes some glitches in making usb bootable and working on most machines. **Make_USB.exe:** [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=5306](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/?showtopic=5306 "External link") **Direct download link:** [http://wimb.winbuild...ad=U_XP_SET.exe](http://wimb.winbuilder.net/downloads/?dir=&download=U_XP_SET.exe "External link") **Known Limitations :** None as of now to my knowledge **4. RMPrepUSB :** **Author: steve6375 (United Kingdom).** It is a small tool to ONLY partition/format a USB device. It has options to set as bootloader either: NTLDR (NT/2K/XP/2003) BOOTMGR (Vista/2008/Windows 7) IO.SYS (DOS) KERNEL.SYS (FreeDOS) It also has the ability to remove some known limitations in usb booting just like in wimb's tool above, and allows for some "peculiar" formatting/partitioning, USB-ZIP like, 64/32 geometry, etc. **RMPrepUSB:** [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=7739](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=7739 "External link") (download link inside the topic's 1st post). **5.BOOTICE :** **Author: Pauly (China).** Current version is 0.78 - English It is a small utility that besides having the ability of partitioning/formatting a USB device it has also options to change the bootloader invoked, thus, it can be useful also as a complement to other partitioning/formatting utilities.

**BOOTICE:** [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=8986](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8986 "External link") **Version 0.78 can be found in the one of the last posts of the topic above** **6.Disk Genius :** **Author: Dahai Lee (China).** The Active production is being lead by DGen (China) now which was the co programmer of Disk Genius . As of this date only version 3.0 Beta 12 is available in English . I am giving the link to UNTOUCHED copy which i downloaded a while back from their Home page (Now Lost) . It is clearly mentioned that for non-commercial purposes this tool can be used .
[http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9459](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9459 "External link")
**7.UBUSB :** **Author: Pcuser (Kneebrasskee).** This is a new utility that puts BartPE/UBCD4Win on your USB drive and can also make a small 40MB iso image used to boot your USB drive on systems that can't boot from USB otherwise. it supports syslinux , grub4dos . more details can be found here , [http://ubcd4win.com/...showtopic=11375](http://ubcd4win.com/forum/index.php?showtopic=11375 "External link") download link [http://www.ezpcfix.n...d4win/UBUSB.exe](http://www.ezpcfix.net/ubcd4win/UBUSB.exe "External link") **edit :** it is GRUB.exe in Disk Genius not GRLDR.exe . sorry . added list of the apps as told by Nuno . kindly let me know if you know any other application which can format and make a usb bootable . **edit 2** : moved pictures to the related topics . added pcuser's UBUSB to the index .

forumNotes.author: Noer5
forumNotes.content:
Great list.

If one has a USB HDD, and makes empty partitions for installs, then are there any of these that will preserve those partitions?

I've used a couple that would see the partitions and allow choice; but then just wipe them all out.

Thanks

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
> Great list.  
> If one has a USB HDD, and makes empty partitions for installs, then are there any of these that will preserve those partitions?  
> I've used a couple that would see the partitions and allow choice; but then just wipe them all out.  
> Thanks

hi Noer5,  
what type of installs on those empty partitions and what do you mean by "wipe them all out"?  

it is possible to have multiple OS booting separately from a single USB drive using grub4dos.

forumNotes.author: Noer5
forumNotes.content:
\>\>what do you mean by "wipe them all out"?

The app would let you choose a partition on the USB HDD, but then just overwrite those partitions so that the only partition visable on the HDD was the first. You could still use a partition recovery app to get back the partitions, so it was apparently just the MBR that was altered.

\>\>it is possible to have multiple OS booting separately from a single USB drive using grub4dos.

Could one create a small "system" partition at the beginning of the USB drive to put grub4dos on and then use that as a boot manager?

forumNotes.author: Zoso
forumNotes.content:
> Could one create a small "system" partition at the beginning of the USB drive to put grub4dos on and then use that as a boot manager?

yes. grub4dos is essential and a must have for any multiboot scenario in my opinion. there is more than one way to start it. it can be installed to mbr or just copied to the first windows partition and started by the windows boot.ini or bcd.  

check the grub4dos subforum here:<http://reboot.pro/forum/66-grub4dos/> for more info.
